item.title: Guide to SSRF attacks
item.description: An SSRF attack is where an attacker tricks a server into making a request to an arbitrary server. Potential uses: Port scanning and information gathering. Exposing sensitive info from unprotected services (yay microservices). Leaking data from internal metadata services in cloud providers. This can include AWS access keys. Anywhere a URL or IP address originates from user-controlled input is a potential attack vector for SSRF. The vulnerable code Code samples
